summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant, conducted on March 16, 2022, as part of the investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview focuses on camera system failures at MCC New York around August 8-10, 2019, a phone call made by Epstein on August 9, and general procedures and events surrounding his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is under investigation. The interview discusses the camera system failure around the time of his death and a personal phone call he was allowed to make.

events.title: Camera system failure discovered
events.description: Lieutenant discovered the NiceVision camera system at MCC New York was not recording and many camera feeds were blacked out. She notified the communications technician and Captain.

events.title: Epstein's personal phone call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was allowed to make a personal phone call from the Special Housing Unit (SHU), reportedly to his mother, facilitated by a Unit Manager. This call was not made through the monitored inmate telephone system.

events.title: Epstein found deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.

events.title: OIG Interview with Lieutenant
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP Lieutenant regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York (interview location)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York (location of Epstein's death and camera failure)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
5-South housing unit (cadre unit) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The BOP Lieutenant testified that on August 8, 2019, the entire camera system at MCC New York was not recording, and many camera feeds were completely blacked out, contradicting prior understanding that cameras were up but just not recording.

A communications technician reportedly told the Lieutenant he "fixed the camera system" on August 9th, but the Lieutenant assumed this meant he got the live feeds working, not that recording functionality was restored.
Jeffrey Epstein was allowed to make a personal phone call on August 9, 2019, from the SHU on a line meant for legal calls, which was against policy as it was unmonitored and unrecorded.
The Lieutenant stated it was her understanding that a Unit Manager gave Epstein the phone call to his mother (who was reportedly deceased), but this was hearsay.

Standard BOP policy requires all inmate calls to be monitored/recorded for security, and exceptions for personal calls in crisis must be made on a recorded line with notification to SIS, which did not happen in this case.
